cryptanthus.sunlight: Bright indirect light to partial shade. Avoid direct sunlight which can scorch leaves.
cryptanthus.watering: Water when top inch of soil is dry, typically every 5-7 days. Keep soil slightly moist but not waterlogged. Reduce watering in winter.
cryptanthus.soil: Well-draining potting mix with peat moss and perlite. Prefers slightly acidic soil (pH 5.5-6.5).
cryptanthus.notes: Earth Star bromeliads prefer higher humidity (50-60%). Mist occasionally or use a humidity tray. Tolerates temperatures between 60-80째F (15-27째C).

cryptanthus_bivittatus.sunlight: Bright indirect light. The pink and green striped leaves maintain better color with consistent light levels.
cryptanthus_bivittatus.watering: Water when top inch of soil feels dry, about every 5-7 days. Allow slight drying between waterings but don't let it completely dry out.
cryptanthus_bivittatus.soil: Light, well-draining mix with peat moss, perlite, and orchid bark. Ensure good aeration around roots.
cryptanthus_bivittatus.notes: Also known as Pink Earth Star. Appreciates 50-70% humidity. Feed monthly during growing season with diluted bromeliad or orchid fertilizer. Leaves may lose color if light is insufficient.

haworthia.sunlight: Bright indirect light to partial sun. Can tolerate some direct morning sun but protect from intense afternoon rays.
haworthia.watering: Water deeply but infrequently, every 10-14 days during growing season. Allow soil to dry completely between waterings. Water less in winter (every 3-4 weeks).
haworthia.soil: Well-draining succulent or cactus mix. Add extra perlite or pumice for improved drainage (50/50 mix recommended).
haworthia.notes: Very tolerant and low-maintenance. Prefers temperatures 65-80째F (18-27째C). Can survive light frost. Prone to root rot if overwatered.

haworthia_zebrina.sunlight: Bright indirect light. The distinctive white horizontal stripes show best with adequate light. Avoid harsh direct sun.
haworthia_zebrina.watering: Water thoroughly when soil is completely dry, approximately every 10-14 days in summer, less in winter. Use the soak-and-dry method.
haworthia_zebrina.soil: Very well-draining cactus mix with at least 50% inorganic material (perlite, pumice, or coarse sand).
haworthia_zebrina.notes: Also called Zebra Plant or Zebra Haworthia. One of the easiest succulents for beginners. Grows slowly and stays compact. Can propagate from offsets. Prefers to be slightly pot-bound.

opuntia.sunlight: Full sun, 6-8 hours daily. Very sun-tolerant and prefers intense light.
opuntia.watering: Water sparingly, every 14-21 days during growing season only when soil is completely dry. Minimal to no water in winter dormancy.
opuntia.soil: Fast-draining cactus mix with sand, perlite, or pumice. Prefers slightly alkaline soil (pH 6.0-7.5).
opuntia.notes: Prickly pear cactus. Extremely drought-tolerant. Handle with thick gloves due to spines and glochids (tiny barbed bristles). Hardy to light frost. Produces edible fruits and pads in mature plants.

opuntia_microdasys.sunlight: Full sun to partial sun, at least 6 hours of direct light daily. Tolerates intense heat.
opuntia_microdasys.watering: Water deeply every 2-3 weeks when soil is bone dry during spring and summer. Stop watering almost entirely in winter (once a month at most).
opuntia_microdasys.soil: Very well-draining cactus mix with high sand or perlite content. Ensure excellent drainage to prevent root rot.
opuntia_microdasys.notes: Also known as Bunny Ears Cactus or Polka-Dot Cactus. Has small white or golden glochids (hairlike spines) that detach easily and can irritate skin - handle with care and use tweezers if needed. Popular ornamental with paddle-shaped pads. Can grow 2-3 feet tall. Native to Mexico.
